title: Bear Needs Help with a Snack Jar

content.en: Most bears are strong and dangerous. But some bears need help.
content.tw: 大部分的熊強壯而兇猛，但有時候也需要別人幫忙！

content.en: A two-year-old bear in a U.S. city needed help. His head was in a big plastic jar. He could not take the jar off. Aww … Poor bear!
content.tw: 有一頭兩歲的熊，牠的頭被卡在透明塑膠罐裡。牠沒辦法把罐子弄掉，需要幫忙！

content.en: Why was the bear's head in the jar? Nobody knows. Maybe the jar had some snacks in it. Maybe he ate the snacks.
content.tw: 我們不知道這頭熊為什麼會把頭卡在塑膠罐裡。可能是吃罐子裡的點心時卡住的！

content.en: The bear could drink some water. But he could not eat. He became very thin. He was about 32 kilograms. Most two-year-old bears are 68 kilograms!
content.tw: 牠可以喝水，但沒辦法吃東西。可憐的熊瘦到只剩下32公斤，比一般的熊瘦很多很多！

content.en: For eleven days, people saw this bear walking around. They called the city. City workers tried to find him. But he walked a lot. He walked about 80 kilometers in one week!
content.tw: 當地的居民看見熊到處走動，他們打給當地機構尋求幫助。但這頭熊很難找，因為牠一個星期可以走80公里！

content.en: Finally, the workers found the bear. They gave him medicine. It made him sleep. Then, they took the jar off of his head.
content.tw: 工作人員終於找到熊了！他們用藥物讓熊睡著後，把罐子從牠頭上摘下來。

content.en: The workers let the bear go. He needs to sleep all winter soon. But first, he needs to eat a lot!
content.tw: 拿下罐子後，這隻熊要馬上去大吃一頓，為冬眠做準備！

content.en: If you see an animal that needs help, call your city!
content.tw: 如果你看到需要幫助的動物，請打電話給你的城市！

vocabulary.preface: 還好有人幫了這頭熊一個大忙。

content.text:
1. take off 拿掉或者脫掉。
Why does your cat look so angry? 你的貓怎麼看起來很生氣?
I tried to take a piece of tape off her tail. 我想把她尾巴上的一片膠帶撕掉。
And she got upset? 她就不高興了?
Yeah. 對。

2. medicine 藥品。
I think you need some medicine for those scratches.
我覺得你那些抓傷需要擦一點藥。
No, I'm fine. 不用了，我還好。

3. poor 可憐的。
Poor cat. 可憐的貓。
She and I don't get along well.她跟我合不來。
Poor you! 你比較可憐。

4. thin 瘦的。
Where did you find her? 你在哪裡找到她的?
In the park two months ago. 在公園，兩個月之前。
She was so thin, only about 2 kilos! 她好瘦，只有兩公斤吧。

vocabulary.postscript: 今天的單字你可記住了? take off拿掉或者脫掉 medicine藥品 poor可憐的 thin瘦的

quiz.question: 1. How many kilograms was the bear?
2. What made the bear go to sleep?
3. What does the bear need to do before sleeping all winter?

title: Belize Wins the World Cup for a Very Old Ballgame

content.en: The Maya people have lived in Central America for thousands of years. These smart people made many new things.
content.tw: 住在中美洲好幾千年的馬雅人十分聰明。他們發明了很多東西！

content.en: The Maya were the first to make rubber. They made rubber balls! They made a game with these balls.
content.tw: 馬雅人也是最早做出橡膠的人，也創造了橡膠球，而且發明橡膠球遊戲。

content.en: The ballgame is called "pok-ta-pok." Maybe it is the first ballgame played in teams! There are two teams. They use a heavy ball. It is three or four kilograms!
content.tw: 這個遊戲叫 "pok-ta-pok"，很可能是第一個分組對抗的球類遊戲！遊戲中用的球有三到四公斤那麼重！

content.en: The players have to keep the ball in the air. That's like volleyball. But they cannot hit the ball with their hands. They hit it with their hips!
content.tw: 選手要讓球保持在空中，像排球一樣！但他們不能用手，而是要用他們的臀部打球！

content.en: The players try to put the ball through a ring. That's like basketball. But the ring is very small! And remember: players cannot use their hands!
content.tw: 選手要像打籃球一樣，把球投進籃框。但籃框非常小，他們也不能用手托球！

content.en: Today, more and more Maya are playing pok-ta-pok. Central America, Mexico, and the U.S. have teams. And every two years, there is a Pok-ta-pok World Cup! Belize won the first three World Cups. Wow! Then Mexico won two. The 6th World Cup was this year. Seven countries played. Belize and Mexico played the last game! And, Belize won!
content.tw: 現在，有越來越多瑪雅人玩pok-ta-pok。墨西哥，美國、和中美洲各國都有球隊。每兩年就會舉辦一次pok-ta-pok世界盃，讓這些球隊一決勝負。貝里斯贏得了前三屆世界盃。哇！接著墨西哥贏得了兩屆。今年是第六屆世界盃。有七個國家參賽。貝里斯和墨西哥打到了最後一場比賽！而且，貝里斯贏了！

vocabulary.preface: 古老的馬雅文化可以追溯到西元前兩千年，他們也會玩球。

content.text:
1. volleyball 排球。
Hey, Nancy! Long time no see! 南西，好久不見! What have you been up to lately? 最近都在忙什麼?
I've been playing volleyball with some friends after work.我下班之後都跟朋友打排球。

2. ballgame 球類遊戲。
Really? I didn't know you liked ballgames.真的喔?我都不知道你喜歡玩球。
I thought you were more of a biker.我以為你比較愛騎車。

3. play 玩。
I was. 以前是。
But my office has this game night every Friday,但是我的公司每周五晚上是玩球日，
and they always play volleyball. 都是打排球。

4. keep 保持。
That's so cool! 真酷呢!
I tried it once but had trouble keeping it in the air.
我玩過一次但是很難維持球不掉下來。

vocabulary.postscript:
你喜歡打什麼球? 來讀單字。
volleyball排球 ballgame球類遊戲 play玩 keep保持

content.en: Eels look like snakes. They move like snakes. But they live in water! Eels are very long fish.
content.tw: 鰻魚長得像蛇，動作也像蛇，但牠們其實是水生動物！

content.en: Long ago, rivers in one part of England had many eels! People could catch two hundred eels in one night! But now people can catch one in one night. Maybe.
content.tw: 很久以前，英國有個地方的河流中有很多鰻魚。可是現在鰻魚數量已經大幅減少。

content.en: Why? Rivers are dirty. Eels cannot find food. And they cannot go to other rivers for food. River walls stop them. Eels need help! But not many people know.
content.tw: 這是因為河流被汙染後，鰻魚找不到食物吃。他們想去別的河流覓食也會被河堤擋住。鰻魚需要大家的幫忙！

content.en: Some people are telling others about eels. One teacher gives baby eels to many schools. The kids give their eels food. They clean the eel tanks. They study all about eels. A few weeks later, the kids put their eels in a river. Now they know eels need help.
content.tw: 有一位老師把鰻魚幼苗分發給不同學校。小學生飼養這些鰻魚，給牠們良好的生活環境。幾個星期之後，小學生把鰻魚送到河流中。

content.en: Other people are helping eels find food. They make big ropes. They put them on river walls. The ropes help eels go over the walls. Then they find food in other rivers.
content.tw: 還有其他人也在想辦法幫助鰻魚覓食。他們在河堤上放繩索，幫助鰻魚跨越河堤，到別的河流吃東西！

content.en: Now more people know eels need help. And more people are helping. Let's hope there will be many eels again in England!
content.tw: 現在有更多人知道鰻魚需要幫助，且越來越多人伸出援手。讓我們希望英格蘭的鰻魚數量能再次繁盛！

vocabulary.preface: 拯救野生鰻魚，有各種不同的方法。

content.text:
1. catch 捕捉。
Did you have a nice weekend? 周末過得好嗎?
Yeah, I just got back from a fishing trip. 很好，我才剛剛去釣魚回來。
Interesting! Did you catch anything? 真有趣，有抓到什麼嗎?
I did! 有!

2. look like 看起來像。
A turtle. 一隻烏龜。
A turtle? 烏龜?
Hey, it's not your everyday turtle. 可不是普通的烏龜。
It looks like a pancake 牠看起來像鬆餅。

3. live 居住。
Turtles are not fish, right? 烏龜不是魚吧?
Of course not. 當然不是。
But they live in water. 不過牠們住在水裡。

4. river 河流。
Did you put your turtle back? 你有把烏龜放回去嗎?
I sure did! It's a nice river. 當然有，那是一條很好的河。

vocabulary.postscript:
還記得剛剛的單字嗎?
catch捕捉 look like看起來像 live居住 river河流

quiz.question: 1. What are eels?
2. Long ago, how many eels could people catch in one night?
3. What are the big ropes for?
options: b. Helping eels go over walls

title: Tomatoes Are Fun in This Town

content.en: Everyone in a small town in Spain is excited. Big trucks are coming! They are full of tomatoes! It's time for a big tomato fight!
content.tw: 載著番茄的大卡車正在開往西班牙的一個小鎮。他們要舉辦一場盛大的番茄大戰！

content.en: Eighty years ago, some kids in the town got mad. They threw tomatoes at each other! That's how the town's tomato fight started.
content.tw: 八十年前小鎮裡面有一群小孩吵架，拿起番茄互相扔，番茄大戰就這麼開始了！

content.en: This year, 22,000 people threw tomatoes! Many came from around the world. They paid 500 Taiwan dollars to throw.
content.tw: 今年，有兩萬多人從世界各地來這個小鎮一起丟番茄！

content.en: There's a rule. Everyone has to squash their tomatoes. That way, no one gets hurt.
content.tw: 番茄大戰有一個規則：所有的番茄都要先壓扁才能丟，這樣才能避免番茄砸傷別人！

content.en: The fun starts! People squash their tomatoes. They throw them! They get more tomatoes! They throw 120 tons of tomatoes!
content.tw: 番茄大戰開始了！大家把壓扁的番茄丟出去，˙一顆接著一顆！他們總共扔了120噸的番茄！

content.en: Wait … Does this tomato fight waste food? Nope! These tomatoes are not good for eating.
content.tw: 番茄大戰並不會浪費糧食，因為這些番茄本來就不是拿來吃的。

content.en: After one hour, the fight stops. The town is very red. Tomatoes are everywhere! Then, fire trucks come. They clean the streets. People take showers outside, with their clothes on.
content.tw: 一個小時後，番茄大戰結束了！小鎮裡到處都是紅紅的番茄汁。消防車開入小鎮，用水柱把大戰後的街道清洗乾淨！大家也都在戶外穿著衣服把自己洗乾淨。

content.en: Everyone had tons of tomato fun!
content.tw: 每個人都玩得非常開心！

vocabulary.preface: 西班牙小鎮這個活動，讓它聞名全世界。

content.text:
1. fight 打仗。
Have you ever had a food fight? 你有玩過食物大戰嗎?
Oh yes, with my sister. 有，跟我姊姊。

2. each other 互相。
We threw popcorn at each other! 我們互相扔爆米花。
And French fries, too! 還有薯條!
It sounds fun! 聽起來很好玩!

3. everywhere 到處。
Yeah, but cleaning was tough. 但是清理可麻煩了。
They were everywhere! 它們掉的到處都是。

4. waste 浪費。
That's why our parents never let us use eggs.
那是為什麼我爸媽從不讓我們用雞蛋。
They said that would waste too much food. 她說那樣太浪費食物。
And it's very hard to clean. 而且超難清理。

vocabulary.postscript:
來讀讀今天的單字。
fight打仗 each other互相 everywhere到處 waste浪費

2. Who started the tomato fight eighty years ago?
3. What is the rule of the tomato fight?

title: Pay for Food With Plastic Waste at This Cafe

content.en: Oh! This cafe looks good! But everyone here has old plastic bags. They have old plastic bottles too. Why?
content.tw: 咦? 這間咖啡館的顧客，手上都拿著舊塑膠袋跟寶特瓶欸！

content.en: This cafe in India doesn't take money. It takes plastic waste! One kilogram of plastic waste pays for one lunch or dinner. People get rice, two kinds of curry, soup, bread, salad, and pickles! Doesn't that sound great?
content.tw: 這家在印度的咖啡廳不收錢，只收塑膠垃圾！一公斤的垃圾可以換到一頓菜色豐富的午餐或是晚餐。聽起來很棒吧！

content.en: Half a kilogram of plastic waste pays for one breakfast. People can get a potato burger. Or they can get a pastry with vegetables in it. Yum!
content.tw: 半公斤的塑膠垃圾也可以換到一份美味的早餐喔！

content.en: This cafe is helping hungry people. It's cleaning up the city too! Every breakfast, lunch, and dinner means less plastic waste on the streets.
content.tw: 這家咖啡館不但能餵飽飢餓的人，也能淨化環境、減少城市中的塑膠垃圾。

content.en: The cafe has been open for six years. People have given it 23 tons of plastic! That's as heavy as 500 10-year-old kids in Taiwan!
content.tw: 咖啡廳已經開幕六年了，六年來他們總共收到了23噸的塑膠垃圾！

content.en: There are more and more cafes like this in India. All of them take plastic waste. Some give food. Some give rice or other things.
content.tw: 這樣子運作的咖啡廳在印度越來越多。他們收下大家的塑膠垃圾後，把大家餵飽！

content.en: Would you take one kilogram of plastic waste and eat at this kind of cafe? Let's go!
content.tw: 你會帶一公斤的塑膠垃圾到這種咖啡館吃飯嗎？我們走吧！

vocabulary.preface: 印度這家店，鼓勵大家回收塑膠垃圾換取食物。

content.text: 1. breakfast 早餐，lunch 午餐. I'm so hungry I could eat 3 burgers! 我餓到可以吃三個漢堡! Oh my! Did you miss breakfast? 天哪，你錯過了早餐? Breakfast and lunch 早餐跟中飯.
2. rice 米飯. Then you should try their fried rice too. 那你也應該試試他們的炒飯。 Bring it on! 都來吧!
3. pastry 糕餅. How about some pastry like apple pie? 要不要來點糕餅，例如蘋果派? I love apple pie! 我喜歡蘋果派!
4. half 一半. Now I'm too full! 現在我太飽了! I'll save half of the pie for later. 我留一半的派晚一點吃。

vocabulary.postscript: 今天的單字每天都會用到。breakfast早餐 lunch午餐 rice米飯 pastry糕餅 half一半

quiz.question: 1. What does this cafe do?
2. How much plastic waste pays for a lunch or dinner?
3. How much plastic waste have people given to the cafe in six years?

title: Turtle Found Five Kilometers From Home

content.en: A family had a turtle. She lived in their garden. But one day, they could not find her! They looked everywhere in the garden. They looked again and again!
content.tw: 有一家人在他們的花園裡養了一隻烏龜。有一天，烏龜不見了！大家怎麼找都找不到他！

content.en: Was the turtle somewhere in the garden? Or did she run away from home? Days went by. Then a month went by. They were sad. Would they see her again?
content.tw: 烏龜離家出走了嗎？過了整整一個月，烏龜還是沒有出現。所有人都很難過，因為他們也許再也見不到他們的烏龜了。

content.en: Five kilometers away, a young girl was walking in a field. She almost stepped on a turtle! She was worried. Maybe the turtle was not safe there. The girl put the turtle in her T-shirt! Then she went to a store.
content.tw: 在五公里外的一片草皮上，一個小女孩差一點踩到一隻烏龜！他擔心烏龜在野外會受傷，所以把烏龜用衣服包起來，交給附近的店家保管。

content.en: The store owner took a picture of the turtle. Then he put the picture online. Four hours later, the family saw it! The turtle was their turtle! They were very happy. They went to the store.
content.tw: 店長拍了烏龜的照片後，上傳到網路上。不久後，那一家人就看到烏龜的照片！那就是他們走失的烏龜！他們迫不及待想把烏龜帶回家。

content.en: This small, slow turtle walked a long, long, way! She crossed fields. She crossed roads. She crossed a small river! And she stayed safe!
content.tw: 這隻小烏龜走了好遠好遠。他跨越了草原、馬路、還有一條小溪。幸好他沒有受傷！

content.en: The turtle is back in her garden. Now the family wants to find the young girl and say "thank you!"
content.tw: 烏龜已經回到她的花園裡了。現在這家人想找到那個小女孩並向她道謝！

vocabulary.preface: 烏龜雖然走得慢，但是也可以走很遠。

content.text: 1. run away 跑掉。My dog ran away again last night. 我的狗昨晚又跑走了。Again? 又一次? Did you scare him? 你把他嚇跑了? No, he loved me! 才不是，他超愛我的。
2. a long way 很長的路。Anyway, a policeman called me today, 不管怎樣警察今天打電話給我，saying the dog is in Beitou. 說我的狗在北投。That's a long way from home! 那離你家很遠呢!
3. cross 越過。Yeah, he had to cross many streets to get there. 對啊，他得過好多條馬路才能到那裏。
4. picture 照片。How did the police know it's yours? 警察怎麼知道是你的狗? I posted his picture online. 我把他的照片po上網。Smart! 真聰明!

vocabulary.postscript: 請跟我一起讀單字。run away跑掉 a long way很長的路 cross越過 picture照片

quiz.question: 1. How long was the turtle away from home?
2. Who found the turtle?
3. Where was the turtle found?

title: Young Man Fights Cancer with His Plane

content.en: A young man loves planes. He became a pilot three years ago. He was 17. A child in his family has cancer. It makes people very sick. The young man wanted to help fight it.
content.tw: 一名熱愛飛機的青少年，十七歲那年成為飛行員。他的家族中有個小孩得了癌症，他決心要幫忙抗癌。

content.en: He wanted people to give money to fight cancer. But how? He had to do something big. He could fly a long way in a small plane, alone! He could go to the seven continents!
content.tw: 他希望幫助癌症病患，但是怎麼幫呢? 他想到可以開著飛機，飛越七大洲來募款！

content.en: He began in North America. Then he flew to South America, Europe, Asia, Africa, and Australia. He went to 60 countries! Then, he flew to Antarctica. He did it! Now he's the youngest pilot to fly alone to the seven continents! People gave money!
content.tw: 最後他抵達南極洲，成為全球最年輕的，獨自飛過七大洲的飛行員! 而且別人還捐錢給他！

content.en: But there were big problems. He broke the law by flying to Antarctica. He had to pay money to a country. But the country will use it for children with cancer.
content.tw: 但是他違反了法律，因為沒有降落南極洲的許可證。他被罰錢了，但那個國家會把錢用在癌症病童上！

content.en: And he could not leave Antarctica for two months! He could not fly his plane, and there were no other planes. But now he is back in the U.S. He will keep flying and fighting cancer!
content.tw: 他被困在南極洲兩個月，這段時間他都不能開飛機，也沒有其他飛機可用。但他現在已經回到美國，他會繼續飛行並對抗癌症！

vocabulary.preface: 這個男孩不但創下世界紀錄，還能獲得捐款。

content.text:
1. continent 洲.
If you could fly anywhere in the world,要是你能飛到世界任何一個地方， where would you go? 你會去哪裡?
Everywhere! At least 3 continents! 哪裡都想去。至少三大洲!

2. Europe 歐洲.
And they are…? 哪三大洲?
Europe, North America and South America! 歐洲，北美洲，南美洲。
So you like America. 所以你喜歡美洲。
Oh, yes. 我是。

3. country 國家.
It has many cool countries like Canada and Chile.它有很多很酷的國家，例如加拿大跟智利。
I guess you're right.你說對了。

4. pilot 飛機駕駛.
Ever thought of becoming a pilot? 你想過去當機師嗎?
No, I can't. I'd get air sick. 我不行，我會暈機。

vocabulary.postscript: 你想開飛機嗎?那要會英文喔! continent洲 Europe歐洲 country國家 pilot飛機駕駛

quiz.question: 1. How old was the man when he became a pilot?
2. Which continent did the man begin flying from?
3. Where was the man for two months?

content.en: It is raining very hard. Streets and homes are flooded. The water is one meter high!
content.tw: 下暴雨了！很多街道跟住宅都淹水了！

content.en: A man is sleeping. A friend's call wakes him up. Huh?! He asks for help! Two older people cannot leave their flooded home!
content.tw: 一名男子半夜被電話叫醒，他的朋友打來向他求救！有兩位老人家裡淹水了，但他們逃不出去。

content.en: The man has a bulldozer. It is very strong. It has a scoop in front. The scoop can move lots of dirt. But, it can carry people too!
content.tw: 這名男子有一台推土機。推土機前面的大鏟子除了可以鏟土，還可以載人！

content.en: The man drives his bulldozer through the flood. He sees people standing on top of their homes! The scoop goes up. He shouts, "Jump in!" People jump in! Ten people ride safely in the scoop! The man takes them to a safe place.
content.tw: 他看到很多人為了避難逃到自己家的屋頂上。他把推土機的鏟子伸長，把在屋頂上的人全部救了下來！

content.en: Then the man drives to the two older people. They jump into the scoop. They are safe!
content.tw: 接著，他開推土機到求救的老人家身邊，用鏟子把他們送到安全的地方！

content.en: The man helps many more people. He works with firefighters too. Sometimes he stops water with his scoop for them!
content.tw: 這名男子和消防隊員一起合作，他用他的推土機幫助了很多人 !

content.en: The flood pushes the bulldozer. But the man doesn't stop. He drives for thirteen hours! He saves more than one hundred people!
content.tw: 水流都快把推土機沖走了，但他沒有放棄。他開了13個小時的推土機，救了一百多個人！

content.en: People call him the "Bulldozer Hero". One man can help many people!
content.tw: 人們稱他為「推土機英雄」。一個人也能幫助許多人！

vocabulary.preface: 說到在水災中救人，一般人不會想到推土機。但是這名駕駛做到了。

content.text: 1. flood 淹水。Did you hear about the flood last night? 你有聽說昨晚的水災嗎?Hear about it? 聽說?The street in front of my house was flooded !我家前面的路都淹水了!
2) firefighter 消防員。I almost needed a boat to get to my car! 差點就需要船來送我去車子。That was really bad! 那真的很慘!Yeah, and even firefighters came around. 對啊，連消防員都跑來。
3) carry 揹著。On a boat? 坐船嗎?No, they walked by, carrying sandbags. 沒有，他們揹著沙包走過去。
4) wake up 叫醒。How about you? 你呢?I was fine.我很好。The sound of the rain woke me up, but that was it.

vocabulary.postscript: 你有看過水災嗎?flood淹水 firefighter 消防員 carry揹著 wake up叫醒

quiz.question: 1. How long did the man drive?
2. Who did the man work with?
3. What do people call the man now?

title: Delicious Treasure Is Going to Yilan

content.en: Narrator: Mmmmmm! Taiwan loves pork belly! It is the meat in lǔ ròu fàn, guà bāo, and other dishes. It is delicious! Pork belly looks delicious too. Under the pork skin, you can see fat, meat, fat, and meat. Ooohh!
content.tw: 台灣人超愛五花肉，滷肉飯、刈包裡面都有！豬皮下面可以看到一層瘦一層肥的肉！

content.en: There is a beautiful piece of pork belly. It's at the National Palace Museum in Taipei. But wait! It's not at the cafe. You cannot eat it. Crowd: What?! Narrator: Why not? Well, it is not food! It is a stone!
content.tw: 故宮博物院有一塊看起來很美味的五花肉！但這塊肉沒辦法吃，因為它其實是一塊石頭！

content.en: Who made it? No one knows. The top of the stone has many little cuts. It looks like pork skin. The sides are colored. They look like delicious fat and meat.
content.tw: 石頭表面上有淺淺的痕跡，四周也都有顏色，看起來就像美味的豬肉。

content.en: The museum has many treasures. People say this stone is the most important treasure!
content.tw: 故宮有許多寶貝，有人說肉形石是最重要的收藏品之一！

content.en: But the pork belly stone will leave the museum for a few months. It is going to Yilan for the first time. The stone will be in a big show at Lanyang Museum. The show is from December 23rd to March 22nd. You can see Yilan's treasures there too!
content.tw: 這塊石頭要暫時搬家了！從12月23號到3月22號，它將首次前往宜蘭。大家也可以在蘭陽博物館欣賞到很多宜蘭的寶藏喔！

content.en: What a great time to go to Yilan!
content.tw: 這真是去宜蘭的好時機！

vocabulary.preface: 故宮博物院的肉形石，是明星展覽品。

content.text: 1. skin 皮。 Oh, this dish looks beautiful! 這道菜真好看!
2. first time 第一次。 You made it yourself?! 你自己做的嗎?!
3. fat 脂肪。 Careful, that's a lot of fat. 你要小心，有很多脂肪喔。 I know, but don't you think it smells too delicious to say "no"? 我知道，但你不覺得這太香了，很難拒絕? I agree. 我同意。
4. meat 肉。 I usually don't eat meat for dinner.我通常晚飯不吃肉。 But I simply must taste this. 但是我一定得嚐嚐這個。 You won't be sorry.你不會後悔的。

vocabulary.postscript: 你今天學到哪些單字? skin皮 first time第一次 fat脂肪 meat肉

quiz.question: 1. What kind of meat does the stone look like?
2. What museum will the stone leave for a few months?
3. Where will the stone be on December 23?

title: No More Home Offices in Cafes

content.en: I want to have a drink at this cafe. But people are sitting … and sitting. Many are using their phones or laptop computers. Some are working. Some are studying. Some are watching videos. Hey, there's a seat! Ahhhh…
content.tw: 這間咖啡廳客滿了。店裡的人都在用手機或電腦工作或是讀書。他們在咖啡廳的時間很長很長！

content.en: In South Korea, many people use their phones and laptops in cafes too. But some people are making home offices in cafes!
content.tw: 在南韓，很多人會在咖啡廳用電子產品。大家開始把咖啡廳當成自己的私人辦公室。

content.en: Some of these people bring printers. Some bring big desktop computers! Some put small walls around their table!
content.tw: 有一些人會帶印表機、桌上型電腦、甚至是隔板！

content.en: And these people sit, and sit… and sit. Sometimes they leave for a long time. But they keep their things at the table. No one else can sit down! This is bad for other people. They cannot enjoy their drinks at the cafe.
content.tw: 這些人會在咖啡廳坐很久，還會用東西霸佔位置。這樣一來，其他的客人都沒辦法在咖啡廳坐下！

content.en: One cafe chain has many cafes in South Korea. Now it has new rules. People can bring phones and laptops. But they cannot bring printers, desktop computers, or small walls. And, people have to take their things when they leave a table.
content.tw: 有一間連鎖咖啡廳設了新的規定。客人可以帶手機跟筆電，但不能帶印表機、桌上型電腦跟隔板，也不能再用私人物品占位子！

content.en: The cafe chain wants everyone to enjoy their drinks. Do you think these new rules will work?
content.tw: 這家咖啡連鎖店希望每個人都能享受他們的飲料。你覺得這些新規定會奏效嗎？

vocabulary.preface: 很多人在咖啡館占了太久的位子，讓別人沒辦法坐。

content.text:
1) drink 飲料。
Ah, I just want to sit down and enjoy a drink. 我只想坐下來喝點飲料。
My feet are killing me!我的腳痛死了。
Same here. But no seats in this cafe.我也是，但是這家咖啡館沒位子。

2) leave 離開。
Should we wait? 我們應該等嗎?
Maybe not. These people won't leave soon.也許不了，這些人不會很快走的。

3) work 工作。
I think they're working here.我想他們在這裡工作。
Yeah, that man even has two laptops with
him.對啊，那個人甚至帶了兩部筆記型電腦。

4) seat 座位。
I only need one small seat. 我只需要一個小小的座位。
I can share it with your bag. 可以跟你的包包共享。
Ha, my bag does need a break.我的包包確實需要歇一下。

vocabulary.postscript:
你想喝點飲料嗎?
drink飲料 leave離開 work工作 seat座位

quiz.question: 1. Where do people make home offices in cafes?
2. What do some people bring to cafes to make home offices?
3. Why is making a home office in a cafe bad for other people?
options: b. They cannot use their phones.
c. They cannot get a drink.

content.en: TAXI!
content.tw: 計程車！

content.en: Have you taken a taxi in Taiwan? Many taxi drivers here know great places to eat!
content.tw: 你有在台灣搭過計程車嗎？很多計程車司機都會知道當地好吃的餐廳在哪裡！

content.en: One day, a man got in a taxi. The taxi driver and the man talked. The man said he did not pay for long taxi rides. Someone else paid for him. This man also said he had lots of online money.
content.tw: 有天，有一位男子坐上計程車。他和司機說他坐長途計程車不用自己付錢，也有很多虛擬貨幣。

content.en: The taxi driver thought the man was a scammer. Scammers try to get money from people. Sometimes scammers tell people, "Let's meet and be friends." Then they ask for money.
content.tw: 司機懷疑這一位乘客是騙別人錢的詐欺犯。

content.en: The taxi driver quietly picked up his phone. He texted someone. Then he talked more with the man. The taxi driver said he knew about a good fish soup place.
content.tw: 司機偷偷傳簡訊給別人後，繼續跟那名可疑的乘客聊天，並向他推薦了一間魚湯店。

content.en: The taxi driver and the man went to the fish soup place. But someone else went too: a police officer! The taxi driver had texted the police!
content.tw: 司機跟乘客一起到魚湯店吃飯。突然之間，警察出現了！原來司機偷偷聯繫了警察！

content.en: The police wanted to ask the man questions. They thought the man was a scammer too. The police are trying hard to find scammers. This taxi driver tried to help them. What a surprise!
content.tw: 警方想盤問這名男子。他們也認為這名男子是詐騙犯。警方正努力追查詐騙犯。這名計程車司機試圖幫助他們。真是令人驚訝！

vocabulary.preface: 計程車司機抓到了涉入詐騙案的乘客。

content.text:
1. taxi 計程車。
Hey, did you see my phone? 你有沒有看到我的手機
I think I left it in the taxi! 我想我把它留在計程車裡了。
Oh no, check your bag and pockets! 糟糕了，檢查一下你的包包和口袋。

2. let's 讓我們來。
I did. I can't find it anywhere. 我看過了，都找不到。
The taxi driver seems like a nice guy. 計程車司機好像人不錯。
Let's call him. 我們來打電話給他吧。

3. place 地方。(按鍵聲音)
Hello, I just took …..(淡出)
The driver said he'll come back to this place to return the phone.
司機說他會回到這裡還給我。

4. police officer 警察。
So nice! 真好!
Yeah, I was worried that I might need a police officer to help.
對啊，我本來還在擔心可能需要警察幫忙。

vocabulary.postscript:
今天的單字你記住了嗎?
taxi計程車 let's讓我們來 place地方 police officer警察

quiz.question: 1. What did the taxi driver tell the man about?
2. Who did the taxi driver text?
3. What did the police want to do?
options: b. Have dinner with the man
c. Ask the man for money

content.en: Skateboarding is cool. Did you know some surfers started it? About seventy years ago, they put roller skate wheels on short surfboards. They surfed the streets!
content.tw: 玩滑板很酷！七十年前，一群喜歡衝浪的人把輪子裝到衝浪板上，就變成了滑板。他們在地面上衝浪！

content.en: Young people fell in love with skateboarding. Skate parks were built all over the world!
content.tw: 年輕人愛上滑板，世界各地都開始出現滑板場！

content.en: Scotland's first skate park was built almost fifty years ago. Skateboarding there was exciting! Scotland's best skateboarders went there! Scotland's first big skateboarding contest was there.
content.tw: 五十年前，蘇格蘭的第一個滑板場出現了！最優秀的蘇格蘭滑板選手都來這裡玩。他們舉辦了蘇格蘭第一場盛大的滑板比賽。

content.en: Skate parks have to be safe for skateboarders. But keeping them safe costs lots of money. So this skate park closed after five years. It was under lots of dirt and trees for many years.
content.tw: 滑板場必須是安全的，但維護場地要花很多錢。滑板場關門後，被樹葉和泥土掩蓋了很多年。

content.en: But now a university is studying the skate park! And some people who were skateboarders at the park long ago are helping.
content.tw: 現在有一所大學在研究這個滑板場！以前在這裡玩滑板的人也來幫忙了。

content.en: Some are helping to take some of the dirt and trees away. Some are sharing stories, old pictures, or old videos of skateboarding at the skate park.
content.tw: 他們幫忙清走樹葉和泥土，也分享大家以前在滑板場玩滑板的照片跟影片。

content.en: Now Scotland won't forget its first skate park again!
content.tw: 現在蘇格蘭不會再忘記它的第一個滑板場了！

vocabulary.preface: 昔日的滑板好手很高興多年之後，能看到老滑板場重見天日。

content.text:
1. forget 忘記。
Do you remember this park? 你記得這個公園嗎?
We used to hang out here after school. 我們以前放學後都在這裡玩。
How can I forget? 我怎麼會忘記?
I walk past here every day. 我每天都走過這裡。

2. old 老的。
We were so young then. 我們那時候好年輕。
You're still young! 你現在還是很年輕!
But I feel old. 但是我覺得老了。

3. story 故事。
Maybe you should write down your stories and share them.
也許你應該寫你的故事然後分享。
Will that make me young again? 那會讓我變年輕嗎?
No. 不會。

4. picture 照片。
But if you post your best pictures, 但是假如你po你最好看的照片，
people will think you're still young.大家會認為你還是很年輕。

vocabulary.postscript:
請跟我一起讀單字。
forget忘記 old老的 story故事 picture照片

quiz.question: 1. Who started skateboarding?
2. About when was Scotland's first skate park built?
3. What was at Scotland's first skate park long ago?

title: Keelung's Old Shelters Become Happy Places

content.en: Narrator: Long ago, Keelung needed shelters for its people. Shelters keep people safe when there is danger. When there is no more danger, people go home.
content.tw: 以前打仗的時候，基隆需要可以讓人暫時避難的地方。

content.en: Hmmmm… What was a good place for these shelters? Well, Keelung has many hills. Workers made more than six hundred shelters in the hills. Whoa! That's a lot!
content.tw: 基隆有很多山地！因此，工人在基隆的山區建造了六百多個防空洞，讓大家可以躲起來！

content.en: Some shelters are small. Three or four people can go in them. Some shelters are big. Many people can go in them.
content.tw: 那些防空洞有大有小，大的可以容納很多人！

content.en: Keelung does not need the shelters now. Many can be scary …Voice: Hello?!!Narrator: They are dark. Water drips slowly. There are snakes! There are spiders! And there are frogs!Voice: Eeeew!
content.tw: 現在，基隆已經不需要這些防空洞了。老舊的防空洞內又暗又潮濕，還會有蛇、蜘蛛、跟青蛙！

content.en: But people want to use the shelters now. Schools take kids there. Kids learn about the shelters. One shelter shows art. One has a restaurant!
content.tw: 防空洞有了新的功能！有老師帶學生去防空洞校外教學，還有一個防空洞被改建成餐廳。

content.en: At first, the restaurant owner worried. Will snakes, spiders, and frogs scare people eating there? No! They laugh! They say "Look! A cute frog!"
content.tw: 起初，餐廳老闆很擔心大家會被蛇、青蛙、和蜘蛛嚇跑。幸好客人都覺得青蛙很可愛！他們看到青蛙後開懷大笑！

content.en: Some of Keelung's old shelters are not scary now. They are for learning. They are for enjoying art and food. These shelters are happy places now!
content.tw: 現在，基隆的一些舊防空洞不再可怕了。它們被用於學習，被用於享受藝術和美食。這些防空洞現在成了快樂的地方！

vocabulary.preface: 基隆很多防空洞已經搖身一變，成為吸引人的所在。

content.text: 1. dark 黑暗的。Wow, this cave is really dark and wet ! 這個山洞真是又黑又潮濕。Are you sure we can come here? 你確定我們可以來這裡?Oh yes, I've seen people coming in. 可以，我看過有人進來。
2. spider 蜘蛛。Hey, something big just moved! 剛剛有大東西在動!Don't say that! 不要那樣說!I already saw two spiders. 我已經看到兩隻蜘蛛了。
3. snake 蛇。Maybe there are snakes here too. 也許這裡還有蛇。Okay, that's it. I'm going out. 夠了，我出去了。No, I'm just kidding! 沒有啦，我開玩笑的!
4. laugh 笑。I'm not laughing. 我可沒在笑。I'm scared. 我害怕。Alright, let's go. 好吧，我們走吧。

vocabulary.postscript: 你有去過防空洞嗎? 來讀單字。dark黑暗的 spider蜘蛛 snake蛇 laugh笑

quiz.question: 1. Why were the shelters made?
2. How many shelters did workers make in Keelung?
3. What do people eating at the restaurant laugh about?

title: A New Cool Animal in Australia

content.en: Australia has many cool animals. One is new to us. It is very cool!
content.tw: 澳洲有很多有趣的生物。現在，有人發現了新的物種！

content.en: Some people were in a forest on a mountain. They saw a tree branch with legs! But it was not a branch. It was a giant stick insect!
content.tw: 有一群登山客在山上發現了一根長了腳的樹枝！但那其實是一隻巨大的竹節蟲！

content.en: The people took pictures. They put the pictures online. That is where scientists first saw this insect. They were excited! Australia has giant stick insects. But this is a new kind!
content.tw: 那群登山客把竹節蟲的照片傳到網路上。科學家看到照片後非常興奮！澳洲有很多大的竹節蟲，但他們第一次見到這個品種！

content.en: This giant stick insect is the heaviest insect in Australia. It is forty-four grams. That is as heavy as a golf ball! Wow!
content.tw: 這隻巨大的竹節蟲是澳洲最重的昆蟲。牠重達44克，跟一顆高爾夫球一樣重！

content.en: This insect is also very long. Look from your teacher's elbow to the end of your teacher's longest finger. That is as long as the insect! Whoa!
content.tw: 這隻昆蟲也很長。牠有一個大人的手肘到指尖那麼長！

content.en: Scientists want to find out more about this insect. It is very big. But it is very hard to find. It lives at the top of tall trees. The trees are on mountains!
content.tw: 科學家想深入研究這種大昆蟲，但這種竹節蟲很難找。他們住在山區的大樹上！

content.en: Scientists also want to find more insects. There are many, many kinds of insects we don't know about. They are hard to find too!
content.tw: 科學家也想找到更多昆蟲。有許多我們不知道種類的昆蟲。牠們也很難找到！

vocabulary.preface: 澳洲發現特大號的竹節蟲，以前沒有記錄過。

content.text:
1. heaviest 最重的。
Why is your backpack so heavy? 你的背包怎麼這麼重?
Oh, this is not even the heaviest. 這還不是最重的呢。

2. insect 昆蟲。
The one I use when looking for insects, 我去找昆蟲時用的背包,
that's the heavy one. 那個才重。
But insects are very light. 但是昆蟲很輕。
True. 沒錯。

3. tree branch 樹枝。
But I also need to bring back stones and tree branches.
可是我得把石頭跟樹枝帶回來。
Because you want to build them a home? 因為你要替牠們建一個家? Yeah.是的。

4. forest 森林。
I study them for a while, 我研究牠們一陣子，
and then send them back to the forest. 然後把牠們放回森林。

vocabulary.postscript:
Do you like insects?
來一起讀單字。
heaviest最重的 insect昆蟲 tree branch樹枝 forest森林

quiz.question: 1. What does the giant stick insect look like?
2. Where did scientists first see the giant stick insect?
3. How heavy is this giant stick insect?

title: Clams Bring People to a Beach

content.en: What do you do at the beach? Some kids play in the water. Some make sand castles. Some pick up seashells. And some dig for clams!
content.tw: 你都在海邊做什麼呢？你可以玩水，還可以在沙灘上堆沙堡、撿貝殼、挖蛤蜊！

content.en: A beach in Chiayi has lots of clams now! Many people know about the clams. They go to the beach. Some moms and dads bring their kids. Everyone looks for clams. It is fun! And it is free!
content.tw: 嘉義布袋的沙灘上有好多蛤蜊！很多遊客會來這個海灘一起撿蛤蜊，不但不用花錢，還很有趣！

content.en: Lots of people walk on the wet sand. The clams are under the sand. People look for little holes in the sand. Then they dig! Some people go in the water and dig.
content.tw: 大家仔細的尋找沙灘上的小坑洞。找到後，他們努力向下挖，挖出藏在沙子裡的蛤蜊！

content.en: People dig for clams in many ways. Some people use shovels. Some use small rakes. Some use nets. Some use baskets. And some use their hands.
content.tw: 大家會用各種不同工具挖洞！有人用鏟子跟耙子，也有人用漁網，水桶，或是直接用手挖！

content.en: Finding lots of clams is like winning a prize! Sometimes people find one clam in ten minutes. Sometimes people get a big basket of clams in thirty minutes!
content.tw: 找蛤蜊就像在尋寶一樣，有的人十分鐘只挖到一顆，也有一些人半個小時內就能挖到一大桶的蛤蜊！

content.en: What do people do with their clams? Some people cook and eat them. Yum! Some people sell them.
content.tw: 蛤蜊可以拿來做什麼呢？有人會把蛤蜊煮來吃，也有人會把蛤蜊拿去賣！

content.en: The beach was quiet before there were clams. Now many people dig for clams there. They have a good time, thanks to the clams!
content.tw: 在有蛤蜊之前，這片海灘很安靜。現在很多人在那裡挖蛤蜊。多虧了這些蛤蜊，他們玩得很開心！

vocabulary.preface: 海灘是充滿趣味的地方，有很多事可以做。

content.text: 1. basket 籃子。It's a nice day today. 今天天氣真好。Let's go dig up some clams! 我們去挖蛤蜊吧!I'm ready. 我都準備好了。I have my shovel, a basket, and sunglasses. 我帶了鏟子，籃子跟太陽眼鏡。
2. look for 尋找。Now where are these clams of yours? 你的蛤蜊在哪裡?Just look for holes in the sand. 你找沙子上的小洞。That's where they hide. 牠們就躲在那兒。
3. cook 煮。There's nothing here! 這裡什麼都沒有!I was hoping to cook and eat them! 我本來希望把牠們煮來吃的!
4. eat 吃。Come on, let me buy you dinner. 來吧，我請你吃晚飯。At a seafood restaurant, right? 去海鮮餐廳對吧?Of course, let's have a good time eating clams there! 當然，去好好吃一頓蛤蜊!
